text: Western Province (; ; ) is one of the five provinces of Rwanda. As of the 2022 census, 2,896,484 people lived there. It has an area of 5,882 kmÂ². The capital city is Kibuye. It was created on 1 January 2006 from the former provinces of Cyangugu, Gisenyi, Kibuye, and a small part of Ruhengeri. It has seven districts of Karongi, Nyabihu, Rubavu, Rusizi, Ngororero, Nyamasheke, and Rutsiro. Category:2006 establishments in Africa Category:Provinces of Rwanda
title: Western Province, Rwanda
